data.text: @GQMagazine @zachbaron Thanks for this. For men who have experienced sexual abuse or assault, we offer free and anonymous 24/7 support, weekly online support groups, and more at https://t.co/MK4uM2To0P.
@GQMagazine Basically, they did nothing and are still doing nothing. All talk & horse shit...
@GQMagazine A victim knows when they've been violated. #metoo

@GQMagazine @glamourmag Oh okay, so anyone can just grope someone now and as long as they claim it was a joke, it's okay? 🤦🏼‍♀️.  Great, so we're already back to people getting away with this shit because all they have to do is say it was a "joke" 🙄.
@GQMagazine Humans life😶🙁
@GQMagazine He's done some interesting work lately.  But, back to comedy soon, Brendan?
UPDATED: The HFPA has issued a response to Brendan Fraser's allegations https://t.co/fFdQ8ngcGM
@GQMagazine @zachbaron I believe YOU Brendan!

@GQMagazine @zachbaron Brendan Fraser is far from a dummy or an innocent face. He’s a strong, grounded and intelligent man. He takes care of his own. Not a “bimbo actor” like that ass-grabber may have presumed.
@GQMagazine @zachbaron Hell of a story. Congrats.

@GQMagazine Thank you, GQ. I'm a subscriber due in large part to profiles like this one.
Hard to believe that the perpetrator's stated intent has more weight than the impact it had on Brendan's psyche.
@GQMagazine Brendan Fraser deserves better.
ICYMI: @zachbaron's February 2018 piece on Brendan Fraser, in which the actor initially revealed he was sexually harassed in 2003 https://t.co/qVnqI6TrOB
@GQMagazine @zachbaron Ah, the gropee has no sense of humour. That's a classic.
@GQMagazine Double standard much?

@GQMagazine Sad that we ask our sisters to stand in the #MeToo movement & we want our male brethren to stand with us, but so many people are quick to dismiss men claiming to have been sexually assaulted. I stand w people like Brendan Frazer & Terry Crews who were brave enough to come forward
"It's not too late,” Fraser told @zachbaron. “They can still do the right thing." https://t.co/mFPXWdNErW
He tells us that they’ve decided to do nothing, concluding that the groping “was intended to be taken as a joke”—but Fraser’s not laughing https://t.co/Qcpo0QaJGp https://t.co/y6vtbIGCtg
Since then, the HFPA has remained silent—but now, according to Fraser, the investigation is officially over https://t.co/8ydwAo8XX1
Last February, he told GQ’s @zachbaron that a member of the HFPA groped him, which resulted in the Golden Globes group announcing an investigation https://t.co/u5SdiecAnL
